reviews.review: Ce jeux est génial, mais la fin est assez spécial !

Ein Spiel das mich gefesselt hat und bis zum Ende nicht los gelassen hat. Die Grafik ist einfach nur Sau-Geil die Farben sind so schön anzusehen. Das Gameplay läuft flüssig und lässt sich präzise spielen. Die Atmosphäre von Columbia ist auch sehr gut man kriegt immer wieder Lust sich ganz Columbia unter die Lupe zu nehmen. Die Spielzeit sind ungefähr 10 satte Spielstunden, das gute an diesem Spiel ist das man erst wirklich erst wenn man es durch hat alles kapiert und es einen so Flasht das man locker noch 10 Minuten nach dem Abspann noch an das ganze Spiel denkt. Die KI ist nicht zu dumm und auch nicht zu schlau allgemein ist BioShock Infinite ein tolles Erlebnis. 10-10 Mein Spiel 2013

"BioShock Infinite" é um jogo especial. Ele se propõe a fazer muitas coisas diferentes e realiza tudo com muita qualidade, sendo competente em várias camadas.

Quem encarar apenas como um jogo de tiro, vai encontrar um game mais refinado do que o "BioShock" original, com equilíbrio entre armas de fogo, poderes especiais e estratégia, graças aos trilhos pelos cenários e os elementos que Elizabeth pode conjurar.

O visual é lindo - especialmente em um PC top de linha -, criando uma metrópole voadora crível e envolvente, que serve de pano de fundo perfeito para a história. Vale o mesmo capricho para a trilha sonora, que ajuda a criar um efeito de imersão sem igual, e a garota Elizabeth, uma das heroínas mais charmosas e marcantes dos games.

Mais adiante, "Infinite" alimenta também discussões sobre racismo, política americana, economia e outros temas de forma mais profunda e contundente do que seu predecessor.

Por fim, as reviravoltas fantásticas na trama e o final chocante exploram dimensões paralelas, viagens temporais e até uma reflexão sobre o próprio ato de jogar e a natureza do jogo em si.

É um jogo que vai ser tema de discussões mil por muito tempo e, a exemplo do primeiro "BioShock", certamente vai influenciar diversos títulos nos anos por vir.
Perfeito, eu pegava

One of the greatest looking games I've ever played. I'm not talking graphics-wise. You can have the most advanced engine ever made. But if you don't have a good art team, the game won't look as good as it could've been. (I'm looking at you Killzone: Shadow Fall)

Bioshock infinite is a awesome game with a really good story.      [STORY] the game is about a man named bokker dewit on a mission to find a girl to take to whipe away a debt but then alot of stuff happens that i wont spoll.     [GAMEPLAY]  Its a first person shotter fps but with powers fire make people fly then shoot them lots of stuff  if you liked the first two bioshocks then you will like this  [SCORE] 9/10 really good

For previous bioshock players , its the same old familiar feeling.  

This time you find yourself up in the clouds , in a magnificent and breathtaking floating city. even tough the graphics havent changed much , the design and imaginary beauty of this game make up to it. gameplay wise its almost the same as the previous titles; there are some minor changes and additions to make it feel different but it doesnt hit the spot.

plot wise  this game will make your head spin, especially towards the end when it gets much more interesting.

do yourself a favour , if you want a challenge , go for the hardest difficulty from the start.

[technical issues] - it has some frame rate drops and slight freezes. i checked the forums and several guides in order to tweak and fix it.

Overall a solid 8/10 game.

This game is amazing! I recommend buying the whole saga of Bioshock.
9.6/10

Fans of the series will absolutely love this. Make sure your head is clear before trying to absorb the ending! Only criticism is that the game is mostly just fetch-quests, but there is enough depth to keep it interesting.

Bioshock Infinite is the kind of game that makes you wonder "What the hell did I just sit through" and then go back to do it again. The gameplay is a bit modern (with a lack of Regen health thankfully) but it fits the idea of a fast paced on the move action adventure, where you constantly have to switch out weapons to better fit the situation.

The story itself is beautiful. A twisted carnival of turns and constant subversions.

The Bioshock series does what it does best and deconstructs typical story devices. I'd say if you have the time and don't mind the mind screw or the gameplay, give it a try.

As a shooter, it's good, not great (and quite challenging). But as a narrative, it's one of the deepest, most beautiful, and most mind-blowing games I've played in my life. Not to mention the graphics are gorgeous and desolate at the same time they're bright and optimistic. 

9.5/10

What can I say that hasn't already been said? Intriguing story, plot twists that are very much in the Bioshock family, and wonderfully developed characters.  Be warned, you will fall in love with Elizabeth. She makes the game that much better.

Потрясная история, которая заставляет задуматься о иных мирах, о перорождени человека и о своих поступках, но в глубине игра несет мораль того, что нужно любить своих детей, бороться за них и не отдавать их никому. Таких игр очень мало, которые несут хоть какую то смысловую нагрузку при прохождении. Игра заслуживает внимания и как минимум детального прохождения со чтением всех записок и прослушиванием всех аудиоматериалов. Элизабет сделана просто великолепно от эмоций и диалогов до финальных титров. Рекомендую 9/10!

+Really lovely, stylized graphics
+A really interesting setting
+Interesting characters (particularly Booker, Elizabeth and the Lutece Twins)
+Great voiceacting
+Fun powers

-Gameplay can be a little repetative. (I've also heard that more hardcore FPS fans find it disappointing, although I can't say myself.)
-Not quite as atmospheric as the other Bioshock games
-Story gets a little off the rails in the second half, ending is love-it-or-hate-it (although I personally loved it)

Overall: I really enjoyed my time with this game, it held my attention the entire time I played it (I breezed through it in a week, which is a little rare for me--I often get distracted from a game halfway through). I really grew attached to a lot of the characters and I LOVED exploring Columbia. The setting, art and soundtrack is fantastic! That being said, I do think the hype of the game has hurt it a little--the gameplay, while fun for me personally, is a little repetative and not particularly complex or difficult. As a story-driven gamer this was fine for me and I loved the game, but if you lean more to gameplay-driven you might find yourself frustrated.

I do think that it's totally worth the price it's currently at, though--I preordered the game at full price and don't regret it one bit, so it's DEFINITELY worth the current price (as I write this, $30). I do highly suggest giving it a try if you're interested in the game, it's really, really enjoyable.

Also, a warning: AVOID SPOILERS AT ALL COSTS. It's much, much better to go into this game fresh than to play it with everyone's opinions and the story spoilers floating around in your head, I feel. Since it was a very hyped and critically acclaimed game there's a ton of arguments about the game on the net--which are worth reading, but AFTER playing the game. Try to go into the game with neither super high or negative expecations from others, I think it's a much more enjoyable experience that way.

The story looses it's ground at times, but this is because it's simply hard to keep all the strings tied together, replaying the game is a solid decision for anyone who might have gone through it a bit too fast.

Definitely one of the top 5 of 2013, in my opinion.

This game has to be one of the most amazing games i've ever played. The story is just a crazy rollercoaster ride that has you bent over on a table and mind-f*cked. First off, the story is quite possibly one of the best stories ever (granted there were some parts in the game that were not necessary). The way the game drops plot bombs on you as you go is just insanely clever, constantly leaving you baffled by the events that pass. The entire setting and scenery of this floating city in the sky, Columbia, is absolutely beautiful while at the same time giving off a eerie vibe as all bioshock games do. There are hardly any flaws in this game in my opinion and i would highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a good story as well as some intense FPSing. The DLC Burial at Sea was definitely worth getting and i can't wait for part two. 9.75/10

P.S That ending though..

La historia de Bioshock Infinite es sencillamente sublime, Columbia es impactante, la relación entre Elizabeth y DeWitt, soberbia. Los primeros pasos por Columbia son tan épicos lo cual demuestra que no es necesario poner scripts pirotécnicos y grandes batallas para cautivar desde el inicio al jugador.

El argumento de Infinite es de esos que parecen simplones, facilones, cubiertos de cliché, pero cuando llega el momento de explicar lo que el jugador vio, ahí es cuando uno se da cuenta que es una trama más profunda y reflexiva.

Este es un juego sumamente recomendado y que vale la pena hasta el último centavo (por lo menos desde mi punto de vista) :D

This is a man's game. It may appear to be some escort mission for a little pansy princess, but that's a LIE! This girl is a real WOMAN, the kind who stays quiet and out of the way so that her MAN can do all the HEAVY LIFTING. In my opinion, ELIZABETH is the perfect example of the IDEAL WOMAN. She will STAY OUT OF YOUR way for the duration of the game, and will BRING YOU GUNS AND AMMO exactly when you need it.

For those reasons, I deem this game worthy of EVERYONE. MEN can learn what it means to be MANLY, and WOMEN can learn what it means to GET BACK IN THE KITCHEN. All this game needs is more sick EXPLOSIONS and killer GUITAR SOLOS.

Buy this game right now. NOW!

edit - If you appreciate the previous two entries in the series, I don't see why you wouldn't enjoy Infinite.  All of the Bioshock tropes are there for you to enjoy.  Instead of dark, water-logged corridors you have clouds and plunges to your doom of the side of floating islands.  The ending is a bit goofy, though.  Don't know how I feel about that, but I did like the journey there.

I was hooked from beginning to end. An amazing, complete gaming and Cinematic experience that leaves you satisfied. I recommend this game to anyone that owns a PC or console. Graphically this is an experience that cant be beaten on PC and to me was more immersive because of this. Either way, play it! Its well worth it! Well done Irrational games. A masterpiece.

With Bioshock Infinite, Irrational Games has delivered a breathtaking (if short) ride from start to finish. Experienced through the eyes of Booker DeWitt, the franchise's latest utopia-gone-wrong, Columbia, is a watercolor painting come to life and is a joy to behold. However, it's Elizabeth, the game's other main lead, who steals the show. Elizabeth is so well realized and beautifully animated/voiced, she'd be right at home in a Pixar or Disney film – she even sings (quite well, I might add) at one point during her and Booker's journey. Without spoiling anything, the story is quite ambitious and largely delivers. However, unlike the first and second games, Infinite does not give the player the chance to make any meaningful decisions and is a more on-rails experience this time around.

From a purely gameplay perspective, Infinite is a solid action-shooter, yet felt uninspiring at times. It takes many cues from Bioshock 1 and 2 while adding several new wrinkles such as the skyline system, and the ability (*minor spoiler*) for Elizabeth to warp in ammo and other helpful items. Plasmids reprise their role in the form of vigors, yet they feel a bit out of place in Columbia and seem like they were only included as a way to make sure franchise veterans would recognize Infinite as a proper Bioshock game. 

In another departure from earlier games, Infinite only allows the player to hold two weapons at a time. While not a huge deal, it makes fully upgrading one or two guns nearly pointless, as you know you'll probably just be picking up whatever is available at any given time. Guns also don't feel as unique as they did in Bioshock 1 or 2.  Enemies are fairly bland and Infinite does not provide enough opportunities to square off against the cooler foes. Midway through the game, fights became more of a chore than anything else -- perhaps this was a result of only playing on medium difficulty.
 
While the gameplay left a bit to be desired, Infinite is an incredible overall experience and the city of Columbia is well worth exploring. I definitely recommend it. If you're on the fence, just wait till it inevitably goes on sale.
